svg:

Benefits of using GraphQL over REST1. Complex Data Requirements: GraphQL is particularly beneficial when your application has complex data requirements. If your client needs to fetch data from multiple related resources or needs different views of the same data, GraphQL's ability to request exactly the data needed in a single query is advantageous. In contrast, REST might require multiple requests or over-fetching data.2. Over-Fetching or Under-Fetching: REST APIs often suffer from over-fetching (retrieving more data than needed) or under-fetching (not getting enough data). GraphQL allows clients to specify their data requirements precisely, reducing the chances of these problems.3. Evolution and Versioning: With REST, versioning can become an issue as you add or modify endpoints. GraphQL's introspection and ability to request only the fields needed by clients make it easier to evolve your API without breaking existing clients. There's no need for versioning in GraphQL.4. Mobile and Web Apps: GraphQL is a good fit for mobile and web applications where bandwidth and performance are crucial. You can minimize the data transfer by specifying precisely what you need in your queries.5. Real-Time Data: If your application requires real-time updates or subscriptions, GraphQL is a natural choice. It has built-in support for real-time data, making it easier to implement features like live chats, notifications, and dynamic content updates.6. Client-Specific Data Needs: In scenarios where different clients (e.g., web, mobile, IoT devices) have varying data requirements, GraphQL shines. Each client can request data that suits its specific needs, reducing over-fetching for some and under-fetching for others.7. Microservices Architecture: If your backend system relies on a microservices architecture, GraphQL can act as a facade, aggregating data from various services into a single, coherent API. This simplifies client-side logic and reduces the need for multiple API calls.client/loginRESTserveruserDetailsproduct details12clientsocket serverdatawithout clientrequest
